intro: Beaufortia orbifolia, commonly known as the orbifoliate banksia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its unique, orb-shaped inflorescence composed of numerous yellow to orange flowers. The plant belongs to the Proteaceae family and is known for its hardy, fire-resistant properties. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to the dry, nutrient-poor soils of its natural habitat. Beaufortia orbifolia plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and maintaining biodiversity.
